alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Bullock; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Pike, south central Bullock and southwestern Barbour Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 542 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Louisville to near Troy. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Clio, Goshen, Louisville, Banks, Blue Springs, Tyler Crossroads, Doster, Antioch, Blue Springs State Park, Troy Municipal Airport, Troy University, Boot Hill, Tanyard, Hamilton Crossroads, Monticello, Springhill, Josie and Tarentum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
